lines.text: David, are you drunk?
I'm just calling to see how everything is.
Oh, everything is fine. It's quiet as a mouse around here.
Alvin's behaving himself?
He is? Well, that's good.
Could I talk to the boys?
Well, I don't see why not.
Is Alvin available?
Available for what?
To talk?
Well, how should I know?
Look, Miss Miller, I just called to see if everything was all right.
Everything's fine, David.
Well, give the boys my love.
Why don't you give them your love?
Well, are they available?
Available for what?
Never mind. Nice talking to you, Miss Miller.
You too, David. And David? Get some rest, will you?
[they both hang up]
Oh, that poor man is losing his marbles.
Alvin, land the balloon by the fountain.
[the balloon lands in a tree]
Like I said, "in the tree!"
What is it, Simon?

It's ancient writing that says, "Sacrifice the full moon on the Prince of Plenty"... That doesn't make any sense. Oh, how silly of me! It's eyes before eats except after teeth. I got it reversed, it says, "Sacrifice the Prince of Plenty on the full moon."
[the full moon comes into view]
Oh no!
They're going to sacrifice Theodore tonight!
Over my dead body!
[cut to a scene where Alvin, Simon and Theodore are being held over a crocodile pit]
You mean over OUR dead bodies!
Prepare for the engagement ceremony! In ten years, I will make her one of my wives!
One of your wives? Oh!
[gets terrified and runs up to Jeanette and hugs her]

[to the prince]
Excuse me, Sir, but uh, you wouldn't want to marry Brittany. You see, she's, well she's, very difficult.
And she's not very tidy.
And her perfume is atrocious!
And she spends money like a drunken sailor!
And... and when she doesn't get her way...
THAT'S ENOUGH, YOU GUYS!
[last lines]
But, Dave, they owe us out $100,000!
Not now, Alvin.
But they've got $5,000,000 in diamonds! Don't we get anything?
Alvin!
But we just cracked a huge smuggling ring!
Shut up, Alvin!
Okay, okay. We'll give you half.
ALVIN!
Maybe you should let Dave drive, Miss Miller.
I wouldn't think of it. Besides, driving relaxes me.
I'm sure you know Sophie, but I don't think you've met Mario. He has a tendency to talk too much.
What's in the ice chest, Eleanor?
Oh, uh, just some cold treats and sandwiches.
Oh, Elly! How can you think of food at a time like this?
It's not your hearing aid, Ms. Miller!
Now let's see... shirts, pants, overcoat, socks... am I forgetting anything?
Me!
Alvin, we've been over this a million times!
Please, Dave! I need a little culture in my life! The Eiffel Tower, the Sixteen Chapel, the Louvre in Rome!
The Louvre is in Paris, Alvin.
You see? I don't even know where the Louvre is!
This is strictly a business trip. It's just not practical. Besides, I hired someone very good to take care of you while I'm gone.
[a car is heard screeching and crashing]
Did it have to be Miss Miller, Dave?
Since when did Alvin like playing "Around the World in 30 Days"?
Since he feels its as close to a world trip as he'll ever get.
You're lucky this is only a game! You'd never beat me if this was for real!
Oh, is that so?
Yeah, that's so! If I had the money, I'd race you around the world right now!
Well, unless you inherit a fortune, Alvin, I guess we'll never know.
I can't believe you decieved Miss Miller for a package of Tutti Frutti, Theodore.
Two packages!
So, Alvin, you finally showed up.
Well, somebody has to win the race.
Simon, which route do you think we should take to Bermuda?
Well, if you insist on going, don't take the east-turning route. I heard on the news there's a hurricane coming in that direction.
Thank you for your advice, Simon.
[drags Jeanette away]
What a liar! He's getting as bad as Alvin!
But what if he's telling the truth, Brittany?
Oh, Jeanette, don't be so naive. He's just saying that because our route is shorter, and he doesn't want us to win.

[to Simon as he's hanging out of the balloon]
Get in, Simon!
Why didn't I think of that?
Isn't Rio beautiful?
We're in Mexico, Theodore.
Oh. That's what I mean.
Your first drop-off is the Cluck'n Taco.
You mean *our* first drop-off.
I'm only along so that you don't get into so much trouble.
I love Athens! The nightlife, the girls, the excitement!
Alvin, you've never been to Athens.
Well, it looks like a city I would love.
If you think I'm going to marry that pint-sized twerp, you're nuts!

[laughing]
Pint-sized twerp? I love that!
[continues laughing, then pauses]
What is a twerp?
I don't care how important he is, how powerful he is, how rich he is... by the way, how rich is he?

[sees their dolls guarded by cobras]
Oh no. How do we get our dolls?
We don't.
Wait a minute. You've heard of snake charmers, right? Well, let's charm them.
We've got to get this little guy back to Antarctica. He'll die if we don't.
And how do you propose we do that, Eleanor? Federal Express?

[yawns]
Jeanette, could you pass me something to eat?
[goes over to the cooler]
Don't do it, Jeanette!
Honestly, Eleanor. When it comes to food, you are really selfish.
[opens the cooler and sees the baby penguin]
A penguin! You are going to eat this penguin?
Simon? I feel kinda funny about tricking Miss Miller.
It's called "guilt," Theodore.
[first lines]
The taxi will be here any minute and I'm not even ready! Has anyone seen my tie?
You're wearing it, Dave.
Three o'clock in the morning, and Prince Theodore has a craving for mushrooms! I hope he chokes on them!
Alvin!
Well, I've had it!
Have you guys been having any trouble along the way?
Well, there was this guy...
[Brittany slaps her mouth shut]
We've had nothing but smooth sailing. And you?
Well, actually, I get the feeling...
[Alvin slaps his mouth shut]
It's been a piece of cake. The only problem we have is crowd control. We're the hottest act in rock and roll. But you don't have that problem, do you?
No.
Sure we do!

[laughs]
No, you don't.
All right, Mister Popularity! How much you want to bet we can out "rock and roll" you?
We've got to keep these two apart!
Contact Jamal and tell him he can have the dolls, but I want the girls!
But Jamal specifically wanted the girls to be returned.
I do not take orders from Jamal! I am doing him a favor, and as payment, I keep the girls!
Oh! Dream on, Tiny Tim!
We're the hottest act in rock and roll. But you don't have that problem, do you?
No.
Sure we do!

[laughs]
No, you don't.
Well, that was quite a breeze!
A breeze? It was a hurricane! Just like Simon said.
Yeah, Brittany. Why don't you just admit you were wrong.
Because I don't think...
Brittany!
Okay, okay, I was wr... wr... wr... Jeanette, where's our first drop-off?
[Jeanette and Eleanor sigh]
Are you thinking what I'm thinking?
Don't be ridiculous. It's too dangerous. They're only children.
Exactly. Who would suspect them?
No, Claudia. It's out of the question.
Listen to me, Klaus! If you think I'm going to make you box up this deal, like you did the last one...
Must you keep reminding me? I underestimated Jamal! It won't happen again!
You bet it won't! We're doing things *my* way this time!
I don't think we should have taken the shortcut. It's too dangerous.
Relax, Theodore. This isn't the arcade game.
[Eleanor and Jeanette have just rescued Brittany from drowning]
We thought you were a goner!
Me too.
We would've been lost without you!
I know.
Thank goodness you're all right!
[picks up the Theodore doll and kisses it]
WHAT?
Just kidding, Brit.

[Grabbing Theodore for a sing-off with the Chipettes]
Come on, Theodore!

[Reaching back toward the counter he was standing at]
But... my couscous!
This happens to be my favorite dress, Jeanette!
Excuse us, but we couldn't help but overhear your conversation.
We were just wondering if you really could win a race around the world.
I would!
Not a chance!
I know she could win.
Would you like to make a little wager?
Why not?
[to Brittany]
I bet a million dollars on this cutie.

[to Alvin]
And I bet on this handsome gentleman.
A million dollars? You're joking, right?
Certainly not. We're quite wealthy, and very bored.
I don't know, they were pretty nice to me.
Just send them a postcard, Theodore.
I'll have two cheese enchiladas with extra sauce, a tostada grande, the quesadilla with a side of guacamole, two chillis with...
They're closed, Theodore.
Oh, fellas!
The instructions say to drop the doll under the little sombrero.

[does so, the sombrero takes the doll and brings a different one in return]
Wow! What do you know? One down, and eleven to go.

[to the sombrero]
And one quesa...
[the sombrero closes]
dilla.
Forget it, Theodore.
Hey, what's all that commotion? It sounds like a big celebration.
Well, they've got a bonfire...
[sees Theodore blurred at first]
...and a chubby little butterball tied to a stake.
[gasps after seeing Theodore clearly]
It's Theodore!

[after the Chipmunks and Chipettes have performed a rocking musical number]
I could've sworn... No, it couldn't be. The boys wouldn't... Would they?

[Brittany and Jeanette are in the sultan's treasure chamber. They see the dolls, but cobras appear]
Oh, no! How do we get our dolls?

[cobras advance]
Uh... we don't.
What a brilliant idea this was of mine!
It's not over yet, Claudia.
Jamal will never suspect them in a million years!
[laughs maniacally]

[feeding the baby Penguin on their way to Antartica]
Just one little bite for auntie Eleanor.
[the baby penguin lets out a weak chirp]
He's getting worse!
What can we do?

[wetting a rag and places it on the baby penguins head]
He needs his mama, Brittany. She'll know what to do.
[Miss Miller is making breakfast for the Chipmunks]

Let's see, Alvin gets the raisin bread, Simon gets the English muffin, Theodore gets the banana bread, the orange slices, the cereal, the bowl of yogurt, the peanut butter sandwich, the pancakes with gooseberry jelly, the scrambled eggs with toast...
